reviewText: One of my all time musical hero's. Harmonica player beyond compare.
Why stop at 2 Ch., Why not 5.1 or better 7.1 Great show as it was his or likely to be his last I'm disappointed the sound was not better in multi channel. However its a MUST

I am a long tern fan of Toots. Watching him t the nadir of his career/life brought me to tears.
I could not bear to watch more than the opening moments. I'll keep the DVD for another time when seeing it will not be so emotional.
So freaking sad.
Music is great, not giving 5 starts because the singer selected is not on the same level of the rest of the band.

Live at Le Chapiteau was released Mar 12, 2013 for the  90th birthday concert of Toots with his European Quartet and special guests Kenny Werner and Trijntje Oosterhuis .For over seven decades he has taken the harp from a novelty instrument to one of distinction and acceptability in many genres.
The bluray audio and video is of the highest quality.
Any Toots fan will find this a must have for their collection.
What is hard to believe to dare there hasn't been a single review of this performance.
This 90-year old jazz harmonica player is still at the top of his game. A priceless DVD. If you love jazz, this is for you.
